N14/4/PHYSI/HPM/ENG/TZ0/XX




      88146501

PHYSICS
HIGHER LEVEL
PAPER 1

Thursday 6 November 2014 (morning)

1 hour


INSTRUCTIONS TO CANDIDATES

• Do not open this examination paper until instructed to do so.
• Answer all the questions.
• For each question, choose the answer you consider to be the best and indicate your choice
  on the answer sheet provided.
• A clean copy of the Physics Data Booklet is required for this paper.
• The maximum mark for this examination paper is [40 marks].




8814-6501                                                                                           20 pages
                                                             © International Baccalaureate Organization 2014
                                                    –2–                  N14/4/PHYSI/HPM/ENG/TZ0/XX

1.    What is the unit for surface heat capacity?

      A.    N m–2 K–1

      B.    kg m s–2 K–1

      C.    kg s–2 K–1

      D.    N m–3 K–1


2.    An object is dropped from rest above the Earth’s surface. Air resistance acts on the object.
      What is the variation of acceleration a with time t for the object?

      A.    a                                             B.     a




                                     t                                                    t


      C.    a                                             D.     a




                                     t                                                    t


3.    Which of the following is a condition for an object to be in translational equilibrium?

      A.    The object must be moving at constant speed.

      B.    The velocity of the object in any direction must be zero.

      C.    The forces acting horizontally on the object must equal the forces acting vertically on the object.

      D.    The resultant force acting on the object must be zero.




8814-6501
                                                         –3–            N14/4/PHYSI/HPM/ENG/TZ0/XX

4.    The resultant force acting on an object of mass 5.0 kg varies with time as shown. The object is
      initially at rest.



                                                   10


                             resultant force / N
                                                     5



                                                     0
                                                         0     0.5         1.0
                                                                  time / s


      What is the speed of the object after 1.0 s?

      A.    0.50 m s–1

      B.    1.0 m s–1

      C.    1.5 m s–1

      D.    2.0 m s–1


5.    An object rotates in a horizontal circle when acted on by a centripetal force F. What is the
      centripetal force acting on the object when the radius of the circle doubles and the kinetic energy
      of the object halves?

            F
      A.
            4

            F
      B.
            2

      C.    F

      D.    4F




8814-6501                                                                                     Turn over
                                                      –4–          N14/4/PHYSI/HPM/ENG/TZ0/XX

6.    Two objects are in thermal contact, initially at different temperatures. Which of the following
      determines the transfer of thermal energy between the objects?

		          I.       The mass of each object
		          II.      The thermal capacity of the objects
		          III.     The temperature of the objects

      A.    I only

      B.    I and II only

      C.    II and III only

      D.    III only


7.    An electrical heating coil of power P is used to transfer thermal energy to a body of mass m.
      In a time t the body changes temperature by ∆θ . What is the thermal capacity of the body?

             Pt
      A.
            m∆θ

              P
      B.
            tm∆θ

            Pt
      C.
            ∆θ

              P
      D.
            t ∆θ


8.    What are the conditions of temperature and pressure at which the behaviour of a real gas
      approximates to the behaviour of an ideal gas?

      A.    Low pressure and low temperature

      B.    Low pressure and high temperature

      C.    High pressure and low temperature

      D.    High pressure and high temperature




8814-6501
                                                    –5–                  N14/4/PHYSI/HPM/ENG/TZ0/XX

9.    Which of the following can be deduced from the second law of thermodynamics?

      A.    Thermal energy cannot spontaneously transfer from a low temperature region to a high
            temperature region.

      B.    Thermal energy cannot spontaneously transfer from a high temperature region to a low
            temperature region.

      C.    The entropy of an isolated system always decreases with time.

      D.    The entropy of an isolated system is the measure of the internal energy of the system.


10.   A body moves with simple harmonic motion (SHM) with period T and total energy ET . What is the
      total energy when the period of the motion is changed to 5T and the amplitude of the motion remains
      constant?

      A.    0.04 ET

      B.    0.2 ET

      C.    5 ET

      D.    25 ET


11.   The natural frequency of vibration of a system

      A.    is the frequency at which it oscillates when it is driven by another system.

      B.    is the frequency at which it oscillates when it is not driven by another system.

      C.    depends on the damping in the system.

      D.    depends on the amplitude of the oscillation of the system.




8814-6501                                                                                       Turn over
                                                       –6–                    N14/4/PHYSI/HPM/ENG/TZ0/XX

12.   X and Y are two sources of waves with identical amplitudes and frequencies. Waves from X and Y
      interfere constructively at a detector after travelling the same distance from source to detector.

                                   intensity of the resultant of the two waves
      At the detector, the ratio                                               is
                                           intensity of one wave alone

            1
      A.      .
            2

      B.    1.

      C.    2.

      D.    4.


13.   A string is made to vibrate at its third harmonic. The diagram shows two points P and Q at a particular
      instant in time.

                                    P




                                                          Q


      Which of the following compares the period of vibration of P and Q and the average speed of
      P and Q?

                  Period of vibration of P and Q        Average speed of P and Q
      A.                     same                                 same

      B.                     same                                 different

      C.                     different                            same

      D.                     different                            different




8814-6501
                                                     –7–                  N14/4/PHYSI/HPM/ENG/TZ0/XX

14.   A source of sound moves away from an observer. The observed frequency of the sound differs from
      the frequency emitted by the source because the

      A.    observed wavelength of the sound is less than the emitted wavelength.

      B.    observed wavelength of the sound is greater than the emitted wavelength.

      C.    speed of sound relative to the observer has decreased.

      D.    speed of sound relative to the observer has increased.


15.   The purpose of the liquid crystal in a liquid crystal display (LCD) is to

      A.    act as a low electrical resistance between the electrodes.

      B.    rotate the plane of polarization of the light passing through it.

      C.    change colour to display a segment when charge flows through it.

      D.    emit light unless charge is flowing through it.


16.   Radiation is incident on a single rectangular slit. The diffracted beam that emerges from the slit
      is incident on a screen. The slit width is then doubled and the wavelength of the radiation is also
      doubled. The intensity of the radiation remains the same.

      Which of the following correctly describes the angular width of the central maximum of the diffracted
      beam and the total number of photons incident every second on the screen?

               Angular width of the         Number of photons incident
                central maximum             every second on the screen

      A.             unchanged                        unchanged

      B.             changed                          unchanged

      C.             unchanged                        changed

      D.             changed                          changed




8814-6501                                                                                       Turn over
                                                   –8–                 N14/4/PHYSI/HPM/ENG/TZ0/XX

17.   What will increase the resolution of an electron microscope?

      A.    Increasing the accelerating voltage to decrease the electron wavelength

      B.    Increasing the accelerating voltage to increase the electron wavelength

      C.    Decreasing the accelerating voltage to decrease the electron wavelength

      D.    Decreasing the accelerating voltage to increase the electron wavelength


18.   A lamp is connected to an electric cell and it lights at its working voltage. The lamp is then
      connected to the same cell in a circuit with an ideal ammeter and an ideal voltmeter. Which circuit
      allows the lamp to light at the original brightness?

      A.                                                 B.




      C.                                                 D.




8814-6501
                                                      –9–               N14/4/PHYSI/HPM/ENG/TZ0/XX

19.   A voltmeter of resistance 50 kΩ is used to measure the electric potential difference in a circuit,
      as shown. The cell has an electromotive force (emf) of 5.0 V and negligible internal resistance.

                                                       5.0 V




                                              50 kΩ            100 kΩ




      What is the reading on the voltmeter?

      A.    1.0 V

      B.    1.7 V

      C.    4.0 V

      D.    5.0 V


20.   A flat coil with N turns has a cross-sectional area A.  The coil has a flux density of B in a direction
      of 90 to the plane of the coil.

      What is the magnetic flux linkage?

      A.    0

      B.    BA

      C.    NB

      D.    NBA




8814-6501                                                                                         Turn over
                                                      – 10 –                N14/4/PHYSI/HPM/ENG/TZ0/XX

21.   The graph shows the variation with time of a magnetic flux passing through a loop of wire.

                                      magnetic flux




                                                      0
                                                          0                  time


      What is the magnitude of the emf induced in the coil?

      A.    The area between the graph and the time axis

      B.    The area between the graph and the magnetic flux axis

      C.    The gradient of the graph

      D.    The inverse of the gradient of the graph


22.   Planet X has mass M and radius R. Planet Y has mass 10M and radius 5R.

                          gravitational field strength at the surface of planet X
      What is the ratio                                                           ?
                          gravitational field strength at the surface of planet Y

      A.    0.4

      B.    0.5

      C.    2.0

      D.    2.5




8814-6501
                                                      – 11 –             N14/4/PHYSI/HPM/ENG/TZ0/XX

23.   A positive point charge P and a negative point charge Q of equal magnitude are held at fixed positions.  
      Y is a point midway between P and Q.




      Which of the following gives the direction of the electric field due to the charges at X, Y and Z?

                  X             Y             Z
      A.       to right      to left       to right

      B.       to right      to right      to left

      C.       to left       to right      to right

      D.       to left       to right      to left

24.   The diagram shows the trajectory of an object projected in the absence of air resistance.

                                   vertical
                                   position




                                          0
                                              0         horizontal position


      The object is then projected with the same initial conditions but air resistance is taken into account.
      Which of the following is the trajectory when air resistance is taken into account? The original
      trajectory is shown as a dotted line.

      A.    vertical                                     B.    vertical
            position                                           position




                   0                                                   0
                       0         horizontal position                       0         horizontal position


      C.    vertical                                     D.    vertical
            position                                           position




                   0                                                   0
                       0         horizontal position                       0         horizontal position

25.   At the surface of a planet of radius r, the gravitational field strength is g and the gravitational
      potential is V.  Which gives the gravitational field strength and gravitational potential at a height 3r
      above the surface?

               Gravitational        Gravitational
               field strength         potential
      A.              g                    V
                     16                    4

      B.              g                    V
                      3                    3

      C.              g                    V
                      4                    4

      D.              g                    V
                      9                    3




8814-6501                                                                                         Turn over
                                                     – 14 –               N14/4/PHYSI/HPM/ENG/TZ0/XX

26.   A negative ion is held at point P in an electric field as represented by the arrowed field lines.

                                                 X




                                                     P        negative ion




                                                 Y

      Which of the following describes the effect on the negative ion when it is displaced in a particular
      direction?

               Direction of displacement                      Effect on the negative ion
      A.             to the left                 magnitude of electric force on the ion is unchanged

      B.             to the right                potential energy of ion increases

      C.             along XY towards X          potential energy of ion increases

      D.             along XY towards Y          magnitude of electric force on the ion is unchanged



27.   Three types of radiation emitted from radioactive materials are given below.

		I.                 Alpha
		II.                Beta
		III.               Gamma

      Which type(s) of radiation has/have a discrete energy when emitted from radioactive materials?

      A.    I only

      B.    I and III only

      C.    I and II only

      D.    I, II and III




8814-6501
                                                     – 15 –             N14/4/PHYSI/HPM/ENG/TZ0/XX

28.   A student suggests the following nuclear reaction between deuterium 21 H and tritium 31 H
                                              2
                                              1   H + 31 H → nX + mY

      where n and m are integers. What are X and Y?

                        X             Y
      A.         electron         neutron

      B.         electron         proton

      C.         alpha particle   neutron

      D.         alpha particle   proton



29.   Which of the following is correct for the de Broglie wavelength λ of a particle when the
      kinetic energy of the particle is EK?

                  1
      A.    λ∝
                  EK


                   1
      B.    λ∝
                   EK


      C.    λ ∝ EK


      D.    λ ∝ EK 2



30.   According to the “electron in a box” model, what is the maximum wavelength of the de Broglie
      wave associated with an electron confined in a box of length L?

            L
      A.
            2

      B.    L

      C.    2L

      D.    4L




8814-6501                                                                                         Turn over
                                                      – 16 –          N14/4/PHYSI/HPM/ENG/TZ0/XX

31.   According to the Heisenberg uncertainty principle, conjugate quantities are pairs of quantities that
      cannot be known precisely for the same object at the same time. What is the unit when two conjugate
      quantities are multiplied together?

      A.    kg m2 s–1

      B.    kg2 m s–1

      C.    kg m2 s

      D.    kg m2 s–2


32.   Three phenomena associated with nuclear and quantum physics are

		          I.       Einstein photoelectric effect
		          II.      de Broglie hypothesis
		          III.     Rutherford alpha particle scattering.

      Which of the phenomena can be verified by firing electrons at a metal surface?

      A.    I only

      B.    II only

      C.    I and III only

      D.    II and III only		




8814-6501
                                                    – 17 –             N14/4/PHYSI/HPM/ENG/TZ0/XX

33.   In a Bainbridge mass spectrometer, fields that contribute to the forces acting on the moving ions are

		I.                 electric
		II.                gravitational
		III.               magnetic.

                                                    spectrometer




                                             ions


      Which field(s) is/are responsible for the curved shape of the ion paths in the shaded region of
      the spectrometer ?

      A.    I only

      B.    I and III only

      C.    II only

      D.    III only


34.   A radioactive nuclide decays to a stable daughter nuclide. Initially the sample consists entirely of
      atoms of the radioactive nuclide. What fraction of the sample consists of the daughter nuclide after
      four half-lives ?

            15
      A.
            16

             1
      B.
            16

            1
      C.
            8

            7
      D.
            8




8814-6501                                                                                       Turn over
                                                   – 18 –             N14/4/PHYSI/HPM/ENG/TZ0/XX

35.   Which of the following is true when thermal energy is converted into work in a single process and
      a cyclical process?

                             Single process                            Cyclical process
      A.      complete conversion of thermal energy         energy must be transferred from the
              into work can occur                           system

      B.      complete conversion of thermal energy         energy must be transferred from the
              into work can never occur                     system

      C.      complete conversion of thermal energy         energy need not be transferred from the
              into work can occur                           system

      D.      complete conversion of thermal energy         energy need not be transferred from the
              into work can never occur                     system



36.   Changes in the climate are leading to a reduction in ice cover on Earth. Which of the following
      describes, for Earth, the change in albedo and the change in the rate of energy absorption?

                 Change in              Change in rate of
                  albedo                energy absorption
      A.          decrease                    decrease

      B.          decrease                    increase

      C.          increase                    increase

      D.          increase                    decrease




8814-6501
                                                                   – 19 –                              N14/4/PHYSI/HPM/ENG/TZ0/XX

                                      relative intensity
                                                              T1




                                                                                                  wavelength

      Which graph shows the emission spectrum for the same black body at an absolute temperature T2
      where T2  >  T1? The original graph is shown as a dotted line.

      A.                                                                B.
                                 T2                                                                            T2
            relative intensity




                                                                             relative intensity



                                 T1                                                                     T1




                                                           wavelength                                                 wavelength

      C.                                                                D.
            relative intensity




                                                                             relative intensity




                                 T1                                                                     T1

                                 T2                                                                     T2

                                                           wavelength                                                 wavelength

38.   The coefficient of volume expansion for sea water is γ . What is the fractional change in the depth of
      the ocean when its temperature changes by 1 K and its area remains constant?
            γ
      A.
            3

      B.    γ

      C.    3γ

      D.    3   γ


39.   What is the equivalent binary number to the decimal number 7?

      A.    1110

      B.    0101

      C.    0111

      D.    1001


40.   What is the charge stored on the pixel of a charge-coupled device (CCD)?

            Potential difference across the pixel
      A.
                 Capacitance of the pixel

      B.    Potential difference across the pixel × Capacitance of the pixel

            Energy stored in the pixel
      C.
             Capacitance of the pixel

      D.    Energy stored in the pixel × Capacitance of the pixel
